block.p: Chawey Wu and Justin Burchett were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Dr. Arnold Thomas, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony at the Riverside Church.
Ms. Wu, 33, is keeping her name. Until last month she was a vice president and security analyst at Marathon Asset Management, an investment advisory firm in New York. She graduated from Columbia.
Chawey Wu and Justin Burchett were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Dr. Arnold Thomas, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony at the Riverside Church.
Chawey Wu and Justin Burchett were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Dr. Arnold Thomas, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony at the Riverside Church.
Ms. Wu, 33, is keeping her name. Until last month she was a vice president and security analyst at Marathon Asset Management, an investment advisory firm in New York. She graduated from Columbia.

She is the daughter of Ginger and Thomas Wu of Franklin Square, N.Y. Her father is a mechanical engineer at Fab-Con Machinery Development Corporation, a manufacturer of equipment for the textile industry in Port Washington, N.Y.

Mr. Burchett, 34, is a founding partner in New York of Structured Credit Holdings, a financial company based in Dublin that invests in derivatives and asset-backed securities. He graduated from Pomona College and received two graduate degrees from Stanford, a master's in economics and a doctorate in political science.
He is a son of Janet and John Burchett of Westfield, N.J. His father is the chief executive of Hanover Capital Mortgage Holdings, a real estate investment trust in New York.
